results.title: Die hard (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: John McTiernan, Joel Silver, Lawrence Gordon, Silver Pictures, Gordon Co and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Bruce Willis stars as New York Detective, John McClane, newly arrived in Los Angeles to spend the Christmas holiday with his estranged wife (Bonnie Bedelia). But as McClane waits for his wife’s office party to break up, terrorists seize control of the building. While terrorists leader Hans Gruber and his savage henchmen round up hostages, McClane slips away unnoticed. Armed with only a service revolver and his own cunning, McClane launches his own one-man war. A crackling action thriller from beginning to end, “Die Hard” explodes with heart-stopping suspense. Also stars Alan Rickman, Alexander Godunov and Bonnie Bedelia. From the novel by Roderick Thorp.

results.title: Dick Smith: make-up artist
results.creator_credit: David E. Smith and Texture Films
results.brief_description: Dick Smith talks about his work as a make up artist for the motion picture industry. He shows the aging techniques he used on Dustin Hoffman in ‘Little Big Man’ and Marlon Brando in ‘The Godfather’. Narrated by David Luster.

results.title: Patrick
results.creator_credit: IFM Films, Richard Franklin, Antony Ginnane and Australian International Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Patrick, having murdered his mother and her lover, has become a polyplegic, pre-oedipal, psychotic lump. He has telekinetic powers, fancies his nurse and is hostile to his doctor. This is an entertaining mix of black humour and suspense with a few shocks. Cast includes Susan Penhaligon, Robert Helpmann and Rod Mullinar.

results.title: Die Fledermaus
results.creator_credit: Humphrey Burton, Richard Gregson, Leopold Lindtberg, Royal Opera House Covent Garden, BBC-TV and Arts Intl
results.brief_description: The Royal Opera Chorus and the Orchestra of the Royal Opera House, conducted by Placido Domingo, appear in this traditional Viennese comedy - the best known and most loved operetta by the King of the waltz, Johann Strauss the younger. Sung in German, with libretto in German and English, but no subtitles. This version has Kiri Te Kanawa as Rosalinde, Hermann Prey as Eisenstein, Hildegard Heichele as Adele and Benjamin Luxon as Falke. Music is directed by Sir Colin Davis.

results.title: Die Flambierte frau = A Woman in flames
results.brief_description:
A raw analysis of class, gender and sex, ‘Women in Flames’ centres on Eva, who one day, without warning, walks out of her stultifying middle-class marriage and into the world of high-class prostitution. Soon she begins an intense relationship with Chris, a fellow prostitute. They move in together but tensions emerge as Eva embraces her sexual freedom and sheds her middle-class moral scruples and Chris’s possessive instincts surface. Set almost entirely in fashionable interiors, stylishly photographed, and with music by Peer Raben the film begs comparison with Fassbinder’s work. Yet Van Ackeren’s film lacks Fassbinder’s assured hand. Cool and distanced, his study of a middle and upper class world ruled by money, power, and sex - where the unexpected and bizarre lie just beneath the tranquil surface, hovers uncertainly between voyeurism and social criticism.

Credits: Director, Robert van Ackeren ; writers, Robert van Ackeren, Catherina Zwerenz ; photography, Jurgen Jurges ; editing, Tanja Schmidbauer ; music, Peer Raben.
Cast: Gudrun Landgrebe, Mathieu Carriere, Hanns Zischler, Gabriele Lafari, Matthias Fuchs.

results.title: Pathways
results.material_description: Multi-channel installation, video, projections, text, audio, bespoke screens, tiered  wooden seating , timber and LED strips
results.brief_description:
A collaboration between artist-filmmaker Jeff Doring and the Ngarinyin Aboriginal Corporation. This spatial installation provides access and insight into the art and culture of the Ngarinyin people. The intention is to record and interpret a broad spectrum of Ngarinyin knowledge and law. The work consists of five discrete and interrelated elements:
1. The Introduction zone: a space consisting of a text, audio, visual introduction to the installation.
2. The Water and Wanjina zone: a corridor with apertures that open on the side to reveal visual works.
3. The Man Blood Law zone: a three screen installation with tiered seating that lies at the end of the Water and Wanjina corridor.
4. The Cave zone: an exhibition space which spatially represents a cave with images projected inside it.
5. The Today zone: a space which provides a contemporary perspective on the exhibition via a web installation.

results.title: Pathways to Australian science: 2 thinking scientifically about crime
results.brief_description: Science - a specific way of thinking and acting, manifesting itself in the “scientific method” - allows legal personnel to reach the truth. Following the example of an arson case, this short documentary follows the process as police gather evidence, conserve evidence, conduct interviews, debrief, hypothesise and consult experts (in this instance a chemicals analysis expert) who will either prove or disprove their theories. At the heart of the investigation is experience, ideas and the importance of not assuming any presupposed truths. Also discusses the necessity of integrating changes in technology using DNA fingerprinting as a specific example.

results.title: Didjeridu: with Charlie McMahon
results.creator_credit: Paul Tait, Jeni Kendell and Gaia Films
results.brief_description: A journey with Charlie McMahon from the famed band “Gondwanaland” into the beautiful country of the Northern Territory. Accompanied by Aboriginal players and makers of the didjeridu, we see how the instruments are made and played by experts.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Tait, Jeni Kendell and Gaia Films

results.title: Jane Edmanson's guide to houseplants
results.creator_credit: Ernest Heffelmyer, Gardening Australia Magazine and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Gardening Australia”.
Jane Edmandson hosts this “Gardening Australia” special on houseplants which covers plant selection, containers and accessories, maintenance, repotting, dealing effectively with pests and diseases, over and underwatering, propagation by cuttings and division, popular flowering and foliage plants, unusual plants such as cacti, orchids and Bonsai, terrariums, holiday care and plant scaping.
